Package org.apache.tamaya.spi

Interface ServiceContext

  • All Superinterfaces:
    ClassloaderAware
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    DefaultServiceContext, OSGIServiceContext
    public interface ServiceContext
extends ClassloaderAware
    This class models the component that is managing the lifecycle current the services used by the Configuration API.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field Description
      static boolean PRIORITY_ANNOTATION_AVAILABLE
      True if the Priority annotation class is available on the classpath.

    • Method Summary

      <T> T register​(Class<T> type, T instance, boolean force)
      Registers the given instance as a singleton service for the given instance, if no instance already has been registered.

      Resets the current service context, removing all loaded services.

      • Methods inherited from interface org.apache.tamaya.spi.ClassloaderAware

        getClassLoader, init

    • Field Detail

      • PRIORITY_ANNOTATION_AVAILABLE

        static final boolean PRIORITY_ANNOTATION_AVAILABLE
        True if the Priority annotation class is available on the classpath.

    • Method Detail

      • checkPriorityAnnotation

        static boolean checkPriorityAnnotation​(ClassLoader classLoader)
        Checks if the Priority annotation class is on the classpath.
        Parameters:
        classLoader - the target classloader, not null.
        Returns:
        true, if the annotation is loaded.

      • ordinal

        default int ordinal()
        Get the ordinal of the ServiceContext.
        Returns:
        ordinal of the ServiceContext. The one with the highest ordinal will be taken.

      • getPriority

        static int getPriority​(Object o)
        Checks the given instance for a @Priority annotation. If present the annotation's value is evaluated. If no such annotation is present, a default priority of 1 is returned.
        Parameters:
        o - the instance, not null.
        Returns:
        a priority, by default 1.

      • getService

        default <T> T getService​(Class<T> serviceType)
        Access a service singleton via its type. If multiple implementations for the very serviceType exist then the one with the highest Priority will be used.
        Type Parameters:
        T - the type of the service type.
        Parameters:
        serviceType - the service type.
        Returns:
        The instance to be used, or null
        Throws:
        ConfigException - if there are multiple service implementations with the maximum priority.

      • getService

        <T> T getService​(Class<T> serviceType,
                 Supplier<T> supplier)
        Access a service singleton via its type. If multiple implementations for the very serviceType exist then the one with the highest Priority will be used.
        Type Parameters:
        T - the type of the service type.
        Parameters:
        serviceType - the service type.
        supplier - the supplier to be used, if no services could be evaluated. If null, an empty collection is returned, when no services could be located.
        Returns:
        The instance to be used, or null
        Throws:
        ConfigException - if there are multiple service implementations with the maximum priority.

      • create

        default <T> T create​(Class<T> serviceType)
        Factory method to createObject a type, hereby a new instance is created on each access. If multiple implementations for the very serviceType exist then the one with the highest Priority will be used as the base for creating subsequent instances.
        Type Parameters:
        T - the type of the service type.
        Parameters:
        serviceType - the service type.
        Returns:
        The new instance to be used, or null
        Throws:
        ConfigException - if there are multiple service implementations with the maximum priority.

      • create

        <T> T create​(Class<T> serviceType,
             Supplier<T> supplier)
        Factory method to createObject a type, hereby a new instance is created on each access. If multiple implementations for the very serviceType exist then the one with the highest Priority will be used as the base for creating subsequent instances.
        Type Parameters:
        T - the type of the service type.
        Parameters:
        supplier - the supplier to create a new service, if no service could be autodetected.
        serviceType - the service type.
        Returns:
        The new instance to be used, or null
        Throws:
        ConfigException - if there are multiple service implementations with the maximum priority.

      • getServices

        default <T> List<T> getServices​(Class<T> serviceType)
        Access a createList current services, given its type. The bootstrap mechanism should order the instance for precedence, hereby the most significant should be first in order.
        Type Parameters:
        T - the type of the createList element returned by this method
        Parameters:
        serviceType - the service type.
        Returns:
        The instance to be used, never null

      • getServices

        <T> List<T> getServices​(Class<T> serviceType,
                        Supplier<List<T>> supplier)
        Access a createList current services, given its type. The bootstrap mechanism should order the instance for precedence, hereby the most significant should be first in order. If no instances could be found, the instances supplied by the supplier given are registered and used.
        Type Parameters:
        T - the type of the createList element returned by this method
        Parameters:
        serviceType - the service type.
        supplier - the supplier to be used, if no services could be evaluated. If null, an empty collection is returned, when no services could be located.
        Returns:
        The instance to be used, never null

      • getResources

        default Collection<URL> getResources​(String resource)
        Loads resources from the current runtime context. This method allows to use runtime specific code to load resources, e.g. within OSGI environments.
        Parameters:
        resource - the resource, not null.
        Returns:
        the resources found

      • getResource

        default URL getResource​(String resource)
        Loads a resource from the current runtime context. This method allows to use runtime specific code to load a resource, e.g. within OSGI environments.
        Parameters:
        resource - the resource, not null.
        Returns:
        the resource found, or null.

      • register

        <T> T register​(Class<T> type,
               T instance,
               boolean force)
        Registers the given instance as a singleton service for the given instance, if no instance already has been registered.
        Type Parameters:
        T - thy type.
        Parameters:
        type - the type to register, not null.
        instance - the instance, not null.
        force - if true, any existing instance will be replaced.
        Returns:
        the instance registered or already present.

      • register

        <T> List<T> register​(Class<T> type,
                     List<T> instances,
                     boolean force)
        Registers the given instancea as servicea for the given instance, if no * instance already has been registered.
        Type Parameters:
        T - thy type.
        Parameters:
        type - the type to register, not null.
        instances - the instancea, not null.
        force - if true, any existing instances will be replaced.
        Returns:
        the instances registered or already present.

      • reset

        void reset()
        Resets the current service context, removing all loaded services. This implicitly triggers a new load of the service context.
